title: Much like L.A., this American-born pope transcends borders
snippets: The faithful in Los Angeles, America's most Catholic city, were delighted — and a little stunned — to learn a Chicago-born priest with deep roots in Peru had been elected to lead the world's 1.4 billion Catholics.
titles: Much like L.A., this American-born pope transcends borders
summary: A Chicago-born priest with significant connections to Peru has been elected as the leader of the world's 1.4 billion Catholics, causing a mix of delight and surprise among the faithful in Los Angeles, the city with the largest Catholic population in America.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides basic awareness about the new pope's background and the reaction among the Catholic population in Los Angeles. However, it does not offer much in terms of actionable insights, deeper understanding, or discussions of progress or solutions.

title: What's in a name? With Leo, new pope shows support for workers and labor unions
snippets: For Catholic theologians, the significance of the name could not be more clear, with the new pope tying himself to one of the foundational figures of modern Catholic social teaching, Pope Leo XIII, who advocated for the rights of the poor and working class.
titles: What's in a name? With Leo, new pope shows support for workers and labor unions
summary: The new pope has chosen a name that aligns him with Pope Leo XIII, a pivotal figure in Catholicism known for advocating for the rights of the poor and the working class. This choice signals the new pope's commitment to issues of social justice and care for the marginalized, reflecting the values of modern Catholic social teaching.
constructiveness_reason: This story gives the reader a deeper understanding of the new pope's values and priorities, as indicated by his choice of name. It also provides context by linking his choice to Pope Leo XIII and his advocacy for the poor and working class. However, it does not report on specific solutions or improvements, nor does it offer actionable insights for the reader.

title: Watch These AppLovin Levels as Stock Soars After Strong Earnings, Sale of Mobile Gaming Unit
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • AppLovin shares surged Thursday after the mobile app marketing provider announced the sale of its mobile game business and quarterly results that topped Wall Street expectations. 
  • The stock has recently broken out above a falling wedge pattern and reclaimed the 50-day moving average.
  • Investors should watch crucial overhead areas on AppLovin's chart around $352, $525 and $940, while also monitoring an important support level near $235.


AppLovin (APP) shares surged Thursday after the mobile app marketing provider announced the sale of its mobile game business and quarterly results that topped Wall Street expectations.

The company, which offers AI-powered software products to assist developers target ads and monetize apps, said late Wednesday it sold its mobile game unit to London-based Tripledot Studios for $400 million and will hold a 20% stake in the private firm following the transaction.

In addition to topping analysts’ first quarter earnings forecasts, the company issued current quarter advertising revenue guidance above expectations, while also pointing out that it focuses on mid-market web advertisers that have less exposure tariffs.

AppLovin shares tumbled as much as 62% between mid-February and early April after short sellers published reports accusing the adtech company of deceptive practices. The stock gained 12% to close Thursday at $339.51, and is up about 70% from last month's low point.

Below, we break down the technicals on AppLovin’s chart and identify price levels that investors are likely watching.

Bullish Momentum Set to Accelerate

After setting a record high in mid February, AppLovin shares staged a sharp reversal back to the 200-day moving average, where they traded mostly sideways since that time.

However, the stock recently broke out above a falling wedge pattern and reclaimed the 50-day moving average in a move that coincided with the relative strength index crossing back above the 50 threshold to signal improving price momentum.

Let’s take a closer look at three crucial overhead areas on AppLovin’s chart worth watching, while also identifying an important support level to monitor during potential pullbacks.

Crucial Overhead Areas Worth Watching

The first overhead area to watch sits around $352. The shares could encounter selling pressure at this level near a trendline that connects the March peak and the upper range of a consolidation period that formed on the chart throughout most of December and January.

A decisive breakout above this area could see the shares climb to $525. Investors who have averaged in at lower prices may decide to lock in profits in this region near the stock’s record high.

To project an overhead area to watch if the stock moves into price discovery mode, investors can use the bars pattern tool. When applying this technique to AppLovin’s chart, we extract the stock’s uptrend from August to December last year that commenced from the 200-day MA and reposition it from last month’s touch of the 200-day MA. This analysis projects a potential longer-term bullish move up to around $940 if price action rhymes.

Important Support Level to Monitor

During pullbacks in the stock, it's worth keeping track of the $235 level. Retracements to this important technical area would likely attract strong buying interest near last month’s initial breakout point from the falling wedge pattern, which also closely aligns with the March trough.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
titles: Watch These AppLovin Levels as Stock Soars After Strong Earnings, Sale of Mobile Gaming Unit
summary: AppLovin shares surged after announcing the sale of its mobile game business to Tripledot Studios for $400 million, while retaining a 20% stake in the firm. This move, combined with quarterly results surpassing Wall Street expectations and positive future revenue guidance, has contributed to a significant recovery in its stock price. After a period of decline due to allegations of deceptive practices, AppLovin's stock has risen approximately 70% from last month's low, closing at $339.51 on Thursday. The company's stock has also shown technical signs of bullish momentum, breaking out above a fa

It provides actionable insights for readers interested in the company or the stock market, and it increases awareness of the impacts of corporate decisions on stock prices.

title: Smart home devices used to monitor domestic workers raise safety concerns
snippets: The growing use of smart home devices is undermining the privacy and safety of domestic workers. New research reveals how surveillance technologies reinforce a sense of constant monitoring and control by domestic workers' employers, increasing their vulnerability and impacting their mental wellbeing.
titles: Smart home devices used to monitor domestic workers raise safety concerns
summary: Recent research indicates that the proliferation of smart home devices is compromising the privacy and safety of domestic workers. These technologies enable employers to maintain continuous surveillance, heightening workers' sense of being constantly monitored and controlled. This increased vulnerability is negatively affecting their mental wellbeing.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful awareness about the negative impacts of smart home devices on the privacy and mental wellbeing of domestic workers. However, it does not offer any solutions or actionable insights to address these concerns.

titles: Non-inherited genes affect children's development

constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information that deepens readers' understanding of the complex nature of genetic impact on children's development. While it does not suggest specific actions or solutions, it can inform decisions about research and policy.

title: Enhanced CAR T cell therapy offers new strategy for lymphoma

title: Removing ovaries and fallopian tubes linked to lower risk of early death among breast cancer patients with BRCA cancer genes
snippets: Women diagnosed with breast cancer who carry particular BRCA1 and BRCA2 genetic variants are offered surgery to remove the ovaries and fallopian tubes as this dramatically reduces their risk of ovarian cancer. Now, researchers have shown that this procedure -- known as bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy (BSO) -- is associated with a substantial reduction in the risk of early death among these women, without any serious side-effects.
titles: Removing ovaries and fallopian tubes linked to lower risk of early death among breast cancer patients with BRCA cancer genes
summary: Researchers have found that bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy (BSO), a surgical procedure to remove the ovaries and fallopian tubes, significantly lowers the risk of early death in women with breast cancer carrying BRCA1 or BRCA2 genetic variants. This study highlights the procedure's effectiveness in reducing ovarian cancer risk without serious side-effects, offering a valuable treatment option for these patients.
constructiveness_reason: This article is highly constructive as it provides readers with actionable insights and deeper understanding of a specific treatment option for breast cancer patients with BRCA1 or BRCA2 genetic variants. It also reports on a solution to lower the risk of early death in these patients, thus highlighting progress in the field of medical research.

title: Social media platform tailoring could support more fulfilling use, study finds

titles: Social media platform tailoring could support more fulfilling use, study finds
summary: New research suggests that redesigning social media platforms to cater to the diverse needs of users could lead to more focused online experiences.
